intro: Hydriastele manusii, commonly known as the Philippine water fern, is a member of the water fern family, Marsileaceae. It is a small aquatic plant that typically grows in slow-moving freshwater environments. The plant has four small, floating leaves that are often mistaken for water clover. It produces tiny, inconspicuous flowers that are pollinated by water currents. Hydriastele manusii is native to Southeast Asia and is valued for its ecological role in maintaining water quality in wetlands.
